headline.print_headline: Law Banning Sugary Foods in Schools Passes

docs.lead_paragraph: Sodas, candy and other foods defined as having minimum nutritional value will soon disappear from school cafeterias and vending machines in the state. The Assembly passed a bill last Monday that prohibits public schools and private schools that participate in government-sponsored child-nutrition programs from serving sugar-laden foods that do not comply with state guidelines.
docs.snippet: Sodas, candy and other foods defined as having minimum nutritional value will soon disappear from school cafeterias and vending machines in the state. The Assembly passed a bill last Monday that prohibits public schools and private schools that...

headline.print_headline: Treating Youngsters and Easing Parents’ Minds
headline.main: Treating Youngsters and Easing Parents’ Minds
Law Banning Sugary Foods in Schools Passes

docs.abstract: New Jersey Assembly passes bill that prohibits public schools and private schools that participate in government-sponsored child-nutrition programs from serving or selling sodas, candy and other foods in which sugar is primary ingredient and to reduce serving foods that contain trans fats (M)
docs.section_name: Health; Education; New York and Region
docs.lead_paragraph: Sodas, candy and other foods defined as having minimum nutritional value will soon disappear from school cafeterias and vending machines in the state. The Assembly passed a bill last Monday that prohibits public schools and private schools that participate in government-sponsored child-nutrition programs from serving sugar-laden foods that do not comply with state guidelines. Among the rules is a directive to reduce serving foods that contain trans fats and a ban on selling any product in which sugar is the primary ingredient.
docs.snippet: Sodas, candy and other foods defined as having minimum nutritional value will soon disappear from school cafeterias and vending machines in the state. The Assembly passed a bill last Monday that prohibits public schools and private schools that...

headline.main: Treating Youngsters and Easing Parents' Minds

docs.abstract: Article on clinic at Edison Elementary School in Port Chester, NY, one of several school-based facilities in Westchester County that not only treat sick and injured children but provide medical checkups and dental care; photos (M)
docs.section_name: Education; Health; New York and Region
docs.lead_paragraph: AT recess, dozens of children tumble into the nurse's office, jackets askew, some with tear-streaked cheeks, fresh from falls and scrapes on the playground at the Thomas A. Edison School. ''Jason threw me a rock on my head,'' Michael Loja, a 5-year-old kindergartner, said as he sat holding an icepack to his forehead. ''It hurt and it bled.''

byline.original: By JENNIFER RITTNER and YASMIN CHIN EISENHAUER

docs.abstract: In this lesson, students share observations and take precise measurements of a playground or activity space. They then design a 1,000 square foot innovative playground environment using precise measurements and prepare a scale drawing with key.
docs.lead_paragraph: Note: This lesson was originally published on an older version of The Learning Network; the link to the related Times article will take you to a page on the old site.
docs.snippet: In this lesson, students share observations and take precise measurements of a playground or activity space. They then design a 1,000 square foot innovative playground environment using precise measurements and prepare a scale drawing with key.

headline.print_headline: At the Temples of Food, an Outsider’s Look at the Sacred Texts
headline.main: At the Temples of Food, an Outsider’s Look at the Sacred Texts

docs.lead_paragraph: A new book posits that misguided gospelmongers are persuading Americans to eat according to ever more irrational notions and sillier motivations.
docs.snippet: A new book posits that misguided gospelmongers are persuading Americans to eat according to ever more irrational notions and sillier motivations.

headline.print_headline: Bias Is Found In Food Studies With Financing From Industry
headline.main: Bias Is Found in Food Studies With Financing From Industry

docs.lead_paragraph: Research studies financed by the food industry are much more likely to produce favorable results than independently financed research, a report to be published today said.
docs.snippet: Research studies financed by the food industry are much more likely to produce favorable results than independently financed research, a report to be published today said.
